citation.article-title: New types of the acetate-oxidizing, sulfate-reducing Desulfobacter species, D. hydrogenophilus sp. nov., D. latus sp. nov., and D. curvatus sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Desulfobacter latus sp. nov.
Desulfobacter latus (sp. no. la'tus. L. adj. latus large, wide)
Nonmotile or motile, elongated oval cells, 1.6-2.4 by 4-7 μm.
Reduces sulfate, but no other electron acceptors.
Acetate is the only electron donor and carbon source used.
The G + C content of the DNA is 44 mol%.
Biotin and thiamine, and 2% NaCl and 0.3% MgCl2⋄6 H2O are required.
Type strain: AcRS2, DSM number 3381, deposited in the Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen, Göttingen, FRG.
